items.content_html:
The move method is not documented.

This method is currently supported only in Firefox. The FileSystemHandle BCD table also has the icon for "Non-standard" next to move.

For now, removing the MDN URL from the BCD table to avoid a 404.

Additional info

  • In the spec linked for queryPermission() and requestPermission() methods of the FileSystemHandle interface, there's no mention of move and remove methods.
  • There's no spec linked on remove method page. Like move, this method is non-standard and experimental.
items.title: Remove mdn url for non-existent page (move method of FileSystemHandle interface)

items.content_html:
Summary

Added the auto value to the animation-duration, in order to show support for this value that which was proposed as part of [https://drafts.csswg.org/css-animations-2/#propdef-animation-duration](CSS Animations Level 2), this way users can easily see where this value has been support and from when.

Test results and supporting details

Currently only supported in Chrome 115.

Related issues

Associated MDN Content issues: 26685 & 26687
Associated Bugzilla bugs: 1808410 & 1737920

Associated MDN Content PR - 27075
items.title: 26685 26687 view progress timelines

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Safari (Desktop and iOS/iPadOS) for the PannerNode API. This removes the prefix data from the interface, as it is only for internal naming and has no effect on accessing the interface. (The constructor was added in Safari 14.1 when the prefix was removed, and I have confirmed neither a webkit or WebKit prefix is supported; the interface was not exposed before then.)
items.title: Update Safari data for PannerNode API

items.content_html:
Summary

Chrome 115 adds the WGSLLanguageFeatures feature of WebGPU. See https://chromestatus.com/feature/5149681044160512.

This includes:

  • The GPU.wgslLanguageFeatures property
  • The WGSLLanguageFeatures class

This PR adds BCD for these new items.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add WGSLLanguageFeatures data

items.content_html:
FF115 adds support for new value option to URLSearchParams.has() and delete() methods. This adds the value.

Lots of tracking info in whatwg/url#735 and testing shows:

  • this is not yet in chrome.
  • Safari says it went into https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safari-technology-preview-release-notes/stp-release-171 which I have marked as preview - is that correct?
  • Node added it in 20.2.0 but latest version is 20.0.0 in BCD. Don't know how I work out engines etc to add that entry - is 20.0.0 close enough?
  • Deno has PR but not yet merged.

Tests on WPT are:

  • https://wpt.live/url/urlsearchparams-delete.any.html
  • https://wpt.live/url/urlsearchparams-has.any.html

Upshot, need to confirm that safari and node values are OK to progress this.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#27172
items.title: URLSearchParams has() and delete() have new value option

items.content_html:
Summary

Addresses the documentation needs of Bug 1606862 Make devtools an optional permission.

No reference found to this permission in the Chrome documentation e.g. https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv3/declare_permissions/#permissions or https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/devtools_inspectedWindow/

Confirmed as included in Safari on this page: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/safariservices/safari_web_extensions/adding_a_web_development_tool_to_safari_web_inspector#3966899
items.title: devtools as optional permission

items.content_html: This PR updates and corrects version values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the SpeechSynthesisVoice API. This bug was discovered when writing tests for the mdn-bcd-collector. This adds a note mentioning this bug and recommending a solution based on GooborgStudios/mdn-bcd-collector@365ad25.
items.title: Update Firefox data for SpeechSynthesisVoice API

items.content_html:
Summary

Compat data about where path() can be used is outdated and inconsistent with other MDN pages, especially clip-path.

This PR aims to fix this and adds an additional row for every place where path() could or could not be used.

Test results and supporting details

I tested that support for path in clip-path was indeed present for the three major browsers, see my comment in #20004.

There is a small mismatch in two version numbers with css.properties.offset-path vs css.types.basic-shape.path:

  • offset-path with path() added in firefox version 72 vs 63
  • offset-path with path() added in chrome version 64 vs 46

I haven't been able to find the truth.

Git logs for chrome 64 contain some mentions of offset-path and path(), but it seems only animation of these was implemented in that release.
Git logs for chrome 46 make no mention of offset-path at all.

Related issues

Fixes #20004, #15961
items.title: Fix incorrect information about path()
